messages.message:
I'm getting an error when trying to run webapp locally. Anyone know whats going on?
```
cd /Users/aarontami/instabase/webserver/webapp/../../webserver/shared/node && /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/usr/bin/make combine-static-files;
./compressor.js
internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:615
    throw err;
    ^

Error: Cannot find module '@node-minify/core'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:613:15)
    at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:539:25)
    at Module.require (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:667:17)
    at require (internal/modules/cjs/helpers.js:20:18)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/aarontami/instabase/webserver/shared/node/compressor.js:2:16)
    at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:738:30)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:749:10)
    at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:630:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:570:12)
    at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:562:3)
make[2]: *** [combine-static-files] Error 1
make[1]: *** [combine-static-files] Error 2
make: *** [compile-static-files] Error 2
```
we updated a package.json in shared/node. You have to run make setup from shared/node folder
@Eric Han can `make setup` not be run from webapp?
I think make setup only exists in the makefile in shared/node
What we actually could do is move everything over to webapp.

I see. Just wanted to make sure that `setup` task still works as expected in webapp. Back in the day, when someone cloned instabase git repo, the very next step was to run `make setup` in webapp to setup local env.
Even then `make setup` in webapp actually called `make setup` in shared/node.
